c74object.name: fl.read~
c74object.digest: Reads from a specified host buffer given an input frame of positions
c74object.description: The output is the same length as the input. The scale, edges and bound parameters control the mapping of the input to the buffer. For hosts supporting multichannel buffers the channel read can also be selected. The reading can be performed with different types of interpolation (or none).

entry.name: /channel [int]
entry.description: Sets the buffer channel to use.

entry.name: /units [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the units used for interpreting the input. Note that the edge parameter is also accounted for normalised mode. This adjusts the scaling to work sensibly with cyclical modes.
[0] - samples[1] - ms[2] - seconds[3] - normalised

entry.name: /interp [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the interpolation mode:
[0] - none - no interpolation.[1] - linear - linear interpolation.[2] - hermite - cubic hermite interpolation.[3] - bspline - cubic bspline interpolation.[4] - lagrange - cubic lagrange interpolation.

entry.name: /edges [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the edge behaviour for both interpolation and reading:
[0] - zero - values beyond the edges of the buffer are read as zeros.[1] - extend - the edge values are extended infinitely in either direction.[2] - wrap - values are read as wrapped or cyclical.[3] - fold - values are folded at edges without repetition of the edge values.[4] - mirror - values are mirrored at edges with the edge values repeated.[5] - extrapolate - values out of range are extrapolated via interpolation.

entry.name: /bound [bool]
entry.description: Sets whether reading is bounded to the edges of the buffer, or can extend beyond it.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.read~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.read~. When set to 0 fl.read~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.read~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
